intro: Epiphora pubescens, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silky pear, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Epiphora pubescens is a member of the Acanthaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun.
